If someone practices a small amount of giving, able to arouse the supreme, vast, and most excellent wholesome mind for all beings, the merit obtained is dedicated to all beings, and such wholesome benefits are inexhaustible;
It is like the rain from heaven pouring into the great ocean, the number of each drop of water cannot be known, and the continuous flow is inexhaustible.

Those who practice giving skillfully dedicate it to all sentient beings. All the merits are also like this. They support all wholesome dharmas, increasing and surpassing each other, also inexhaustible, until becoming a Buddha and the myriad wholesome [dharmas] are perfected.
